headline: Goldman Sachs And These Banks Just Aced The Fed's Stress Test: Analyst
summary: Goldman Sachs led the Dow Jones Industrial Average higher on Monday morning after it cleared the Federal Reserve's stress test with flying colors.  Analysts also placed Wells Fargo and M&T Bank among the biggest winners of the Fed's annual test, which determines how well a bank's capital buffers can survive a crisis.  The Fed's clearance for the banks to lower their capital reserves should free up space for additional lending, dividends, stock buybacks and possibly acquisitions.

headline: C Clears 2025 Fed Stress Test: Make Investment or Still Wait?
summary: As Citigroup clears the 2025 Fed stress test with a 10.4% CET1 ratio, will it pave the way for buybacks, dividend hikes and leaner operations?

raw.headline: C Clears 2025 Fed Stress Test: Make Investment or Still Wait?
raw.summary: As Citigroup clears the 2025 Fed stress test with a 10.4% CET1 ratio, will it pave the way for buybacks, dividend hikes and leaner operations?

headline: What’s Next for Goldman Sachs and Other Banks After Acing Fed's Stress Test
summary: All 22 banks in this year’s stress test had enough capital to absorb more than $550 billion in losses during a severe downturn, and still continue lending, the Fed said late Friday.  Under the Fed's hypothetical recession scenario, banks’ common equity Tier 1 capital ratio—a key measure of balance-sheet strength which calculates capital against assets—declined 1.8 percentage points.  Goldman Sachs is set to see the largest easing of capital requirements, said Barclays analysts.

headline: 3 Reasons to Avoid WFC and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Since June 2020, the S&P 500 has delivered a total return of 99.4%. But one standout stock has more than doubled the market - over the past five years, Wells Fargo has surged 216% to $80.90 per share. Its momentum hasn’t stopped as it’s also gained 14.9% in the last six months, beating the S&P by 10.4%.
